availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Garrett Davis (Kentucky attorney, farmer, and politician)

body.p: Kentucky attorney, farmer, and politician. Kentucky native. Married to Rebecca Trimble Davis. Married to Eliza Jane Morrow Davis. Father of Robert Trimble Davis, Caroline Scott Davis Magowan, Rebecca T. Davis, Garrett Morrow Davis. Employed in the Montgomery County and Bourbon County office of the county clerk. Studied law and was admitted to the bar in 1823. Attorney in Paris, Kentucky. Member of the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1833 to 1838. Whig member of the United States House of Representative from 1839 to 1847, serving the Twelfth and Eighth Congressional Districts of Kentucky. Attorney and farmer in Paris, Kentucky. Delegate to 1849 Kentucky Constitutional Convention from Bourbon County, Kentucky. Declined nomination by the American Party for governor of Kentucky in 1855. Declined nomination by the American Party for President of the United States in 1856. Member of the United States Senate from 1861 to 1872. Regent to the Smithsonian Institution from 1864 to 1872.
